thread.title: October is the time for scary movies in Ionia
thread.title_full: October is the time for scary movies in Ionia

author: Nicholas Grenke ngrenke@sentinel-standard.com
title: October is the time for scary movies in Ionia
text: October is the time for scary movies in Ionia Family Video in Ionia has the treats; ranks top rentals Comment Posted Oct. 16, 2015 at 5:21 PM By Nicholas Grenke Posted Oct. 16, 2015 at 5:21 PM IONIA The Halloween season is close at hand, and terrors on the screen are in demand, so if you feel like getting scared, remember you can still rent a movie around here. The staff at the Family Video in Ionia recently complied a list of the seven most popular scary movie rentals this year. While new arrivals top the list, Manager Jessica Fritz said many other classic horror films are also available to check out. “We put together a section of some of our Halloween favorites,” Fritz said. “There are lots of choices that you can't always find on Netflix or online.” In fact, the store has the original 1978 version of “Halloween” directed by John Carpenter, (and the movie's numerous sequels,) plus other thrillers such as the 1973 classic “The Exorcist.” “We also have more family friend rentals for children, that aren't as scary,” Fritz said. Some examples of the family friendly films are “The Dog that Saved Halloween” and “Casper.” The top seven films this October at Family Video in Ionia are: 1. “Poltergeist”
